title: Script Font - Eddie Cochran C'mon Everybody single 1950's
author: Gavlar

comments.content:
There were very few swash fonts in use in the 1940s when the label was designed.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015115256im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LondonRecords_3467.jpg)
  
I venture that the logotype LONDON is precise lettering, inspired by the Caslon Swash fonts then available. See for example the ATF catalog of 1934:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015115256im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ATF1934p66Caslon471SwashSM_4723.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015115256im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ATF1934p66Caslon540SwashSM_3538.jpg)
  
Don
